intro: Comesperma silvestre, commonly known as the wild comesperma, is a shrub native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Comesperma silvestre is often found in heathlands and woodland areas, where it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
